statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Virginia Tech 71, Marshall 54
article.story: BLACKSBURG, Va. (AP) -- Deron Washington scored 17 points as Virginia Tech beat Marshall 71-54 Monday night. It was the second straight game where the sophomore stepped up to fill the void left by Coleman Collins, who is out due to family issues. Zabian Dowdell added 16 points for Virginia Tech (4-1), and Jamon Gordon had 15. Marshall (0-1) won the board battle 42-29 as forward Travis Aikens grabbed 11 rebounds. He also led the Thundering Herd with 16 points. The Hokies countered by taking care of the ball, committing just six turnovers while forcing 17. The Thundering Herd cut the lead to 38-33 in the opening minutes after the half. Aikens drove for a layup to cap a 7-0 run, but Marshall never got closer. Dowdell's 3-pointer started an 11-1 spurt as the Hokies took control of the game 56-41 with 7:18 to play. Dowdell, coming back from first-half foul trouble, scored 14 of his 16 points down the stretch as Virginia Tech held off the Herd. Chris Tucker's free throw opened a 67-47 lead with about three minutes left.
